{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3557100,"name":"","username":"naack","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/a9adbd/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-14T16:57:08.270Z","cooked":"

Hi,

Our team is having some issues with pathplanner’s rotation control tuning and not really sure where to go from here. Physical observations right now are that when P is less than 1, our robot spins forever and when P is greater than 1 it doesn’t spin forever but its very shaky. I tried adding a D value but still not great results. Here is some pathplanner telemetry output from a test at P=1, D=0.

image1274×281 105 KB

Our current code is here: https://github.com/Lawnmowers-5530/2025/tree/prod-updates.
The main reason the shaky movement is bothering us is because its slowing down our paths and making our tag relative vision alignment code a little less reliable. Any help would be greatly appreciated, thank you.

We have had pretty good results with the default P values of 5. Did you configure Pathplanner’s weight and MOI values? We found these to have a large impact on over/unsershoot.

I did configure the weight but only approximated the MOI. How can we find that more accurately? Thanks
